heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 09 November 2025, the rain lasted for 144.8 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  47.89mm accumulated and it fell at 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 02 February 2026 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 0 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 111 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 214 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 111.4m lower than yesterday, 160.6m lower than the past week, 213.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 604m and a peak of 818m, averaging 571.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
